page.title: 02LANDSCAPE. FARMING
page.content: During May & June 1985 we tried to record the crop growing in all fields. Farmers were provided with a map dated 1952, & asked to state type of crops & update field boundaries.We discovered many fields have increased in size by 4 times.Hedges have been grubbed up & pit-ponds filled in to aid the use of larger machinery & increase production Two small areas of woodland have disappeared.Land use is balanced be_ tween grass & cereals.Grasslands are used for cattle pasture, hay & silage. Childrens' ponies are often seen in the paddocks. The cereals are wheat & barley in equal acreage.Other crops include peas, potatoes & oilseed rape. Rape has become a relatively common crop only in the past 5yrs.Its vived yellow flower shines across the fields & its pungent scent adds a new dimension to Warwickshire in May/June.
